sect2.title: Configuring libusb
sect2.para: libusb requires the usbfs kernel filesystem to be mounted on /proc/bus/usb. Applications require the files in this directory to be accessible to the user, sometimes for both reading and writing.
To restrict access to USB devices, create the usb group:

To get usbfs mounted on boot, we will create a special init script, because just putting an extra line into /etc/fstab does not work for those who compiled "USB device filesystem" as a kernel module. Install /etc/rc.d/init.d/usb init script included in the package.
